column4: Taiwan stocks rise; TSMC jumps on strong July sales
column5: TAIPEI  Aug 11 Taiwan stocks rose 1.3 percent on Tuesday as investor sentiment was bolstered by gains on Wall Street  with TSMC leading tech heavyweights higher after the world's top contract chip maker posted solid July sales results.

column4: U.S. crane maker Terex to merge with Finland's Konecranes
column5: HELSINKI U.S. cranes and mining equipment maker Terex  and Finnish rival Konecranes  have agreed an all-share merger  hoping a combined $10 billion in annual revenues will help them better cope with cooling Chinese and weak European demand.

column4: UPDATE 2-US crane maker Terex to merge with Finland's Konecranes
column5: * Konecranes shares jump 25 percent to record high   (Adds analyst  company comments  detail  background  shares)

column4: BRIEF-Konecranes shares jump on Terex merger announcement
column5: * shares rise about 18 percent after Terex merger announcement  Source text for Eikon:  Further company coverage:    (Reporting By Jussi Rosendahl)

column4: U.S. crane maker Terex to merge with Finland's Konecranes
column5: HELSINKI  Aug 11 U.S. crane maker Terex  and Finland's Konecranes have agreed on an all-share merger to complement their businesses and achieve cost savings  the companies said on Tuesday.

column4: Automakers feel China heat as buyers burnt by stocks rout desert showrooms
column5: BEIJING  Aug 11 The great Chinese stock slump that first whacked luxury car sales is spreading to mass-market brands as wannabe customers like Zhang Jiabin count the cost of soured investments.

column4: Mobile operator Turkcell considering Lebanon tender
column5: ISTANBUL  Aug 11 Turkcell is considering participating in a tender for management of a state-owned mobile network in Lebanon  the Turkish mobile company said on Tuesday.

column4: U.S. judge tells Cablevision to stop calling Verizon 'liar'
column5: NEW YORK A U.S. judge has ordered Cablevision Systems Corp to stop running advertisements accusing rival Verizon Communications Inc of lying about having the fastest wireless network.

column4: Tired  speeding driver held responsible for 2014 Tracy Morgan crash
column5: WASHINGTON A speeding Wal-Mart truck driver who had been awake for 28 hours was held responsible on Tuesday for a 2014 highway crash that left "30 Rock" star Tracy Morgan with brain injuries and killed a fellow comedian  U.S. transport regulators said.

column4: UPDATE 3-Tired  speeding driver held responsible for 2014 Tracy Morgan crash
column5: WASHINGTON  Aug 11 A speeding Wal-Mart  truck driver who had been awake for 28 hours was held responsible on Tuesday for a 2014 highway crash that left "30 Rock" star Tracy Morgan with brain injuries and killed a fellow comedian  U.S. transport regulators said.

column4: BUZZ-Cruise & theme park operators: Yuan devaluation takes a toll
column5: ** Cruise operator Carnival and Merlin  the world's second largest theme park operator behind Walt Disney  down 1-2 pct as companies seen likely to be hurt by a weaker Chinese yuan currency

column4: Exclusive: Wells Fargo explores sale of crop insurance business
column5: Wells Fargo & Co  may divest its crop insurance business  one of the biggest in the United States  a spokeswoman told Reuters on Tuesday  as regulatory restrictions on U.S. banks force some to reconsider underwriting insurance policies.

column4: ON THE MOVE-LPL Financial hires adviser from Wells Fargo
column5: Aug 11 LPL Financial LLC said on Tuesday financial adviser Michael Palace has joined Gladstone Wealth Group from Wells Fargo Advisors.

column4: Alberta issues environmental order after Syncrude Canada heron deaths
column5: Aug 11 Alberta's energy regulator on Tuesday ordered Syncrude Canada to develop a wildlife mitigation plan and publish more information following the death of 30 blue herons at an oil sands site in the Canadian province.
